text: Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has malt, caramel, bourbon, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, alcohol, bourbon, and wood, leading to dry alcoholic finish.

Aroma and taste is sweet malty with a plethora of dark dried fruit, some caramel and toffee sweetness, some lovely spices, resonating bourbon soaked wooden accents into the finish. Gorgeous.
33 cl. bottle. A dark brown coloured beer wit a small beige head. Aroma and flavour of dried fruit, caramel, hops, alcohol, malt, oak, bourbon and with a sweet finish.

33 cl bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty. Breadish and slight caramelish. Sweet, vanilla and toasted malty. Slight breadish and caramelish. Dry and roasted. Dark malty and roasted into the finish.

Thank you kraddel & tderoeck! Sampled draft @ VCBF 2017. Dark brown amber, little tanned head. Nose is sweet cough syrup, herbal, bitter medicinal leaves. Taste is medicinal sticky herbal cough syrup, banana, sugar, boozy bourbon. Thick herbal, boozy. Like it more than the base beer but it is still far too thick medicinal cough syrup for me, not my preferred profile as Barley Wine goes.
Bottle. Big vanilla nose, bourbon, wood. dark, hazy brown. Smooth ass flavor, coconut, vanilla, chocolate, almost no booze noticeable. Lovely stuff.

Bottled several times. Deep black, creme head, vanilla sweet aroma with bourbon on background. Intensive and reach sweet malty flavor with delicate bourbone and wood on background. Very good barley wine.
Very smooth sweet malty nose with oak and vanilla in the nose. Very sweet mouth with tons of oak and vanilla with cherries and tootsie rolls. Sweet and big but never cloying for 16%. Very nice stuff

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2017 Bottle at home. Deep, reddish copperish colour, no head. Nose is strong bourbon notes, with dried fruits, mostly raisins. Taste is low bitterness, intense vanilla, dried fruits, caramel. Smooth mouthfeel, almost no carbonation. Definitve alcoholic warmth. Interesting, rich and complex, like a barrique redwine.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2017 Drank with Lennart 17-05 at the roof. Awesome smell. Taste is sweet malty, alcohol also. Comprehensive, but not very complex. 

Edit: drank at VCBF 17 next to Kamikaze from Struise, this one clearly being the more balanced and rich beer. Very good one.
Bottle at home. Nice aroma of bourbon and cherries in chocolate. Taste is roasted nuts, dried fruits, wood, chocolate and bourbon.

Izgalmasnak tűnő barley wine az észt mesterek műhelyéből, amely 16%-os alkoholtartalmával, bourbon hordóban történő érlelődésével kívánja learatni a babérokat az efféle huncutságokra fogékony közönség tagjainál. Rezes, borostyán-testén nem igazán pihen meg a piszkosfehér habfedő, vékonyka gyűrű formájában hirdeti csak sör mivoltát a főzet felső rétege. Krokantos, nugátos, karamellás, majd kókuszos, vaníliás, ázott fahordós, klasszikusan bourbon-jellegű aromái remekül korbácsolják fel a kedélyeket, a hasonlóan vérmes ízvilág megfelelő nyitányául szolgálnak az orrbavágó erejű elemek. Cukrozott aszalt paradicsomos, angolszász stílusú barley wine letisztult, elegáns vonalakkal megáldott, karakteres szerkezettel, melyben a parfümös, fűszeres malátafolyam komótos folyása mentén likőrös, férfiasan alkoholos jegyek villannak meg, s tompítják kissé az érzékszerveket, majd a kifinomult, markáns, kesernyésen tartalmas levezetés rántja össze ismét a sokszínű kompozíciót. Az érlelés ez esetben kifogástalan módon teszi a dolgát, s vértezi fel az eleve ízletesnek ható italt újabb rétegekkel, összességében tehát valóban top 50-es barley wine benyomását keltve.

Degustacja podczas Silesia Beer Fest 2017

Gęste, lepkie i oleiste. Piękne "lzy" na szkle. W aromacie jest słodko: miód, karmel, figi, rodzynki. W smaku podobnie. Pięknie wykleja. Alkohol mega ukryty.

Genialne!

Bottle (33 cl ) at home. Pours unclear very dark amberbrown, small white head. Smell is some oak, mild bourbon, very intense maltyness. Some ambermalts, underneath a full pack of intense fruity ( raisins ) aspects. Very full. Taste is full, sweet, very silky mf, oak, bourbon, bit sharp bitter touch near the end, but is overpowered by the silky, extremely smooth mouthfeel of the maltbomb. Bit boozy, but not at all 16 ABV boozy to me. Low carbonation, giving full intensity to the experience of the flavor itself. aftertaste is full, malty, mild sweetness, some bourbon, late oak (vanilla) and a warmth of the alcohol in the actual finish. very, very nice barleywine.

Rami Rami is drinking an Odravein Bourbon BA (Cellar Series) by Põhjala at Powiśle

Geste, intensywne, waniliowe, suszowe, rodzynkowe, kokosowe, migdalowe, ciut dziegciowe i ziolowe, slodkie, alko czuc lekko jak na %. Klasa
Z: słodko, zbożowe, jest szlachetny alkohol. S: tęgo, słodowo, na koniec beczka wychodzi. Fajne.

Lots of bourbon, caramel, honey, dried fruits in aroma. Pours brown with beige head. Taste is sweet with vanilla, caramel, fruitiness, bread, alcohol. Medium bitter finish with some booze, oily texture, flat carbonation. Overall very good.
Brown, stable head. Aroma: malt, barrell, coconut. Lot of sweetness, full body, medium bitterness. Flavour: caramel, hay, dry fruits, lots of barrell. Well hidden alcohol.
W zapachu alkohol, miód, zboża i burbon. W smaku słodko, miodowo. Całkiem przyjemne, na plus na pewno świetnie schowane te 16% alkoholu.

Mooi donkerrobijnrood bier met fijne crèmekleurige schuimkraag. Vanaf het openen van het flesje (wat nog een onderneming is) komt het aroma je tegemoet. Rood fruit, confituur, bourbon. Lekker zoetig maar niet té. Perfect in balans. Alcohol goed verborgen. Eén van de beste barley-wines ooit gedronken !!!

20th March 2017Very hazy amber - brown beer, good pale tan head. Palate is smooth and mildly dry and has reasonable fine carbonation. Smooth malts, a little malt cream. Lots and lots of bourbon, buckets of it! But its smooth and fruity, only modest bourbon spice. A little ripe fruit. Smooth slightly spicy finish. Does not drink like 16%. Total Bourbon bomb! Love it!

33cl bottle at home from Berts Bierhuis Biltstraat, Utrecht. Nose is coconut, bourbon. Body is opalescent reddish brown, head is small, cream white, frothy, mostly diminishing, fair lacing. Aroma is coconut, milk chocolate, herbs, bourbon, caramel. Medium sweet, medium roasty bitter, light fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting roasty fruity medium bittersweet, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, oily sticky texture, medium carbonation. Quite heavy, strong flavor, very tasty, well balanced, great one.
Fajna beczka, dobrze uzupełnia piwo, lekko za bardzo drewniana moze. Do tego fajny bw

Pours brown with a tiny head. Aroma is sweet with lots of caramel, toffee, slight chocolate, vanilla, sweet bourbon and dark fruits. Very sweet and inviting barley wine aroma. The taste has a bit more grain to it but still has those sweet notes of toffee, caramel, sweet bourbon and dark fruits. Also there is quite a bit of booz in this in the end. A nice winter warmer nevertheless.

Fantastic beer. Sweet aroma: malts, figs, dactyls. Taste is very sweet, but it doesnt make this beer weary. Additionally to sweet malts and fruits theres also a hint of coconut, especially in aftertaste. Definitely one of the best beers Ive ever had.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2017 Bardzo duża beczka, nie przykrywa to jednak podbudowy słodowej która jest naprawdę świetna. Wysycenie troszkę psuje to piwo ale po zakręceniu szkłem i odgazowaniu go jest fajnie. :) Całej butelki bym nie wypił bo troszkę męczące sie z czasem robi

The aroma is full of dried fruits, booze, caramel, sweet chocolate and sugar. The color is murky and like a not so dark coffee color. No head at all but thats the usual case with barley wines. The taste is full of dried fruits, booze, caramel and sugar, not my kind of beer. Too sweet and boozy!

Aromat: na bogato- chleb, karmel, suszone owoce, ciasta z imbirem, nawet cytryny. Są oczywiście nuty beczkowe z wanilią czy kokosem na cele, ale... dopiero po drugim niuchu, bowiem na początku akcenty słodowe je przytłaczają. Obecny także alkohol, ale przy takim ekstrakcie (ponad 26 blg) to nie dziwi.

Wygląd: barwa ciemno pomarańczowa, do czerwonej, zamglona. Pina jasno beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, niewielka i umiarkowanie trwała. Gęsta i oleista konsystencja. 

Smak: duża słodycz, ale nie zamula. Właściwie to samo, co w aromacie z dodatkiem nut przypieczonych czy powideł pomarańczowych. Jest dobrze. Goryczka umiarkowana, wzmacniana przez alkohol, ale z drugiej strony kontrowana przez słodycz, zatem wypada dobrze. Zdecydowanie tęga pełnia, niskie do umiarkowanego wysycenie i lekko kwaskowy, chlebowo- karmelowy finisz z alkoholem wyraźnie rozgrzewającym przełyk.

Bardzo dobre piwo, choć miałem nadzieję na jeszcze większy wpływ beczki. Do tego zważywszy na dość wysoką cenę, oscylująca między 35-40 zł zastanawiałbym się jednak nad jego ponownym kupnem.

Clear brown pour with basically no head. Sweet raisin, malt aroma with a little apple juice on the side and some brandy like booze. Doesnt really smell like bourbon much rather like cognac or even apfel schnapps. The taste is rich with a big malty body, caramel and a boozy finish. Fairly drinkable for 16% actually. Still would prefer this a little lighter on the booze

Pianka drobna, cieniutka, szybko opada do firanki. Barwa mocnej herbaty, opalizująca. Aromat intensywny, beczkowy, sporo wanilii, kokosa, rodzynek, daktyli, karmelu, whisky... Super! Smak niczym nie ustępuje zapachowi - bogaty, wyrazisty, masa wanilii, kokosu, bourbona, suszonych owoców, karmelu, toffi, cukierków Werthers Original... Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie, alkohol początkowo delikatnie muskający podniebienie w miarę picia staje się coraz bardziej bourbonowy, koniakowy, przy czym na deklarowane 16% zdecydowanie szlachetny i przyjemny. Pełne, wyklejające, niezbyt gęste w odbiorze.

Klasa piwo, mimo że dość rzadkie. Zdecydowanie #teamslodyczka, aczkolwiek nie zalepiające czy mulące, myślę że równowagę daje tu ta whisky.

De geur is waanzinnig lekker een van de lekkerste die ik rook. Brood, karamel, rozijnen en gedroogd fruit, mooie mout en sterke alcohol. De smaak is voll, met de nadruk op mout, de bourbon komt er mooi door. Geeft de indruk dat hij vrij lang heeft gerijpt. Heerlijk mondvullend en prachtige afdronk. Top.

Bottle. Copper red color. Heavy aroma of bourbon vanilla, raisin, ripe fruit, caramel and booze. Taste has raisin, soft buttery caramel, smooth silky bourbon vanilla, booze, red fruit and a long bourbony finish. Great beer.

Data ważności:  19.09.2019 
 Kolor:  Przepiękny mahoniowy kolor z wieloma czerwonawymi odblaskami. 
 Piana:  Żółta, drobno pęcherzykowata, niska.
Z sykiem opada w dół. Nie wznosi się wyżej niż na 3 milimetry. Nie ma lacingu, jedynie pojedyncze plamki na szkle. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest przepiękny. Słodki, likierowaty. Duża doza owoców kandyzowanych, a wraz z nimi rodzynki, winogrona, figi, daktyle.
Potężne, słodkie bogactwo.
Nuty beczki po bourbonie w drugim rzucie - dużo klimatów kokosowych, waniliowych i karmelowych. 
 Smak:  W smaku od pierwszego kontaktu piwo jest pełne, słodkie, zaklejające usta.
Jak na tacy dostajemy tutaj całą gamę owoców kandyzowanych (brzoskwinie, morele, śliwki, nektarynki).
Dodatkowo nie zabrakło daktyli, fig i rodzynek.
Akcenty beczki dają posmaki kokosowe i waniliowe.
Ostatnimi wyczuwalnymi elementami jest karmel i toffi.
Goryczka jest zaskakująco wysoka. 
Pomimo pełnego charakteru sam finisz trunku wydaje się dość gorzki.
Piwo jest oleiste, obłędnie kisielowate i średnio wysycone. 16% alkoholu rozgrzewa od środka, ale ani na milimetr nie wychodzi przed szereg.
Rewelacyjne Barley Wine. 
 Wysycenie: Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Niesamowicie złożone i bogate Barley Wine.
Nie można kompletnie niczego mu zarzucić. 
Beczka po bourbonie dała intensywne akcenty dębiny, whisky, drewna.
Ogromny wpływ na profil piwa mają akcenty owoców kandyzowanych, a wraz z nimi fig, daktyli i rodzynek.
Odravein pomimo wysokiej zawartości alkoholu (16%!) jest nadzwyczajnie gładkim, oleistym, gestym trunkiem.
Piwo dostojne, smaczne i perfekcyjnie dopieszczone w każdym detalu.

Bottle 330ml. @ home. [ As Põhjala Cellar Series - Odravein Bourbon BA ].Clear medium to dark red brown color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, bread, caramel, caramelized malt, dried fruit, bourbon, alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, sugary, caramelized, dried fruit, bourbon, alcohol, bread, laber larver. Body is medium to full, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft to flat, finish feel is light to moderate alcoholic. [20170110]
 8-4-8-4-16
Geringe Karbonisierung. Holzig alkoholischer Antrunk, etwas süß, geringe Herbe. Hell holzig bleibend, steigend würzig, spät hefig, der Alkoholanteil steigt. 10/11/10/10/9/10

Bottle at WilliamK Kurvi. Dark brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with resin, caramel, toffee, pine, bourbon, vanilla, oak, raisins and a bit of hops. Surprised by not finding any obvious alcohol taste in the body despite the super strong ABV. Bitter finish with resin, toffee, bourbon, vanilla, oak, nuts, raisins, a bit of hops and caramel. Magnificent barley wine, world class stuff.

Butelka. Piana niska, nietrwała, szybko znika. Aromat średnio intensywny lecz złożony. Morele, daktyle, dużo słodkiej wanilii, bourbon. Beczka nie zdominowała bazy piwa co bardzo cieszy. W smaku istne szaleństwo. Bourbon + dużo wanilii. Na drugim planie, słodycz suszonych moreli i fig. Przyjemnie delikatnie zalegający posmak. Konsystencja oleista. Alkohol genialnie ukryty. Nie powiedziałbym, że to piwo ma aż 16%!!! Pijalność wzorcowa. 

Znakomity trunek, który bardzo szybko znika ze szkła. Drugie moje piwo po Porridge Bullet, które wysoka stawia poprzeczkę. W przeciwieństwie do Porridge Bullet beczka znakomicie z dużą intensywnością i przyjemnością daje o sobie znać. Klasa trunek

the aroma is caramel and fruity with hints of toffee, bourbon, coconut, raisin, dried fruits, red wine and milk chocolate... the taste is caramel and fruity with notes of toffee, coconut, bourbon, brown chocolate, bisquit, dried fruits, port and nuts... sweet, dry and warming aftertaste...

Bottle, 16%. Unclear dark amber/ brown with tiny head. Aroma is malt, caramel, toasted, dark fruit, bourbon and vanilla. Flavour malt, caramel, toasted, wood, oak, bourbon, vanilla, sweet, warming, hop, notes of alcohol and a little bitter.

(Põhjala Cellar Series - Odravein Bourbon BA) Bottle 330ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 16%
Dark brown colour on the body, clear, with a small and thin tan head on top, low retention. 
Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, dark fruits, caramel, alcohol.
Taste is sweet with alcohol, bourbon, dark fruits, dates, figs.
Medium thick body, soft carbonation warming feeling from the alcohol.
Great.

Bottle from Tidens Farver, Aarhus. Hazy dark red brown with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit, bourbon and alcohol. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with lots of warming alcohol. Oily and soft. 180117

AIBF2016. Dark blackish brown pour with s small forthy tan head. Caramel, toffee, pom esters, vanilla, leather and bourbon nose. Heavy sweet and light bitter taste. Syrupy sticky mouthfeel. Bit too sticky and sweet for me to fully enjoy.

Flaska från Kihoskh, Köpenhamn. Delad med Samuel214. Utifrån beskrivningen antar jag att flaskan är dryga året gammal. Mörk, rubinröd/mahogny med litet beiget skum. Stor, söt och tung doft av torkad frukt, russin, inlagda/romdränkta bär, katrinplommon, bourbon, vanilj, ekfat, kokos, en aning choklad, likörpralin, varmt och torrt bastuträ. Stor kropp, men inte så massiv som en kanske kunde vänta sig. I början upplever jag den som bara en gnutta för "pigg" och tänker att den kanske skulle legat något år till ändå. Men en bit in så är det inget som stör mig, snarare känns den alldeles lagom. Fortfarande håller inte smaken ihop riktigt lika väl som doften, även om det fortfarande är i hög klass. Torkad frukt, bourbon, russin, lönnsirap, ekfat, vanilj, marsipan, en liten gnutta salmiak och läkerol. Alkoholen väl dold. Inledningsvis lite spritig, men 16% märks definitivt inte av. Mycket gott, hade gärna tagit en till...
Extremely strong, nice aroma, like nutty, vanilla, malty parfumes. Brown, very fine colour, little carbonation, small foam, extremely nice finish. After second bottle and Id love to store more
Excellent, well placed, slightly dry, without additional sweetness. Really sensational.

330 ml bottle. #304. At the Konttori, Tampere, Finland.
Dark red color with a small off-white head.
Sweet malt, Bourbon, mild farmyard and some alcohol in the aroma. 
The flavor is sweet malt, Bourbon, sugar, molasses and some alcohol. 
Slow-drinking. Really sweet.

33 cl bottle @ Olutravintola Konttori. BBE 19.09.2019.
Pours clear dark mahogany color with a small head. Aroma has strong vanilla and bourbon, toffee and caramel, toasted malts. Flavor is quite sweet with caramel and toffee vanilla, bourbon notes, ripe fruits. Alcohol somewhat hidden, dry finish. Ive had similar before, nothing special here. Good anyway.
5425

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 Oh ja, da denkt man, man hat schon so viele wunderbare Sude getrunken und dann schwups SOWAS!!! Wahnwitzig bourbonaffin. Es duftet komplex nach Dörrobst, Vanille und extrem nach Whiskey. Fett. Beim trinken dann ebenfalls intensivst. Süßholz, Cake und rote Beerenflavours, gesellen sich hier zu den BOURBONbrechern. Mal wieder ein Kaminbier der Sonderklasse. Gewichtig und nahe der Perfektion, ein Ritt durchs Pöhjalawunderland. Ich knie nieder..😀. Flasche, 0,33l, für ca. 8, BEYOND BEER HH.

Flaska från Kihoskh, Köpenhamn. Delad med Lilja. Utifrån beskrivningen antar jag att flaskan är dryga året gammal. Mörk, rubinröd/mahogny med litet beiget skum. Stor, söt och tung doft av torkad frukt, russin, inlagda/romdränkta bär, katrinplommon, bourbon, vanilj, ekfat, kokos, en aning choklad, likörpralin, varmt och torrt bastuträ. Stor kropp, men inte så massiv som en kanske kunde vänta sig. I början upplever jag den som bara en gnutta för "pigg" och tänker att den kanske skulle legat något år till ändå. Men en bit in så är det inget som stör mig, snarare känns den alldeles lagom. Fortfarande håller inte smaken ihop riktigt lika väl som doften, även om det fortfarande är i hög klass. Torkad frukt, bourbon, russin, lönnsirap, ekfat, vanilj, marsipan, en liten gnutta salmiak och läkerol. Alkoholen väl dold. Inledningsvis lite spritig, men 16% märks definitivt inte av. Mycket gott, hade gärna tagit en till...

Dark brown with medium yellow head. Sweet bread/kvass aroma. Sweet malty /bread taste with some sourness, immediately followed by strong bitterness rich of whiskey notes. Lasting bitter aftertaste. Good for slow enjoying.
Full bodied flavorful barley wine. Sweet fruits, caramel, bourbon, oak, some roasted malts, all in balance. A bit boozy in the finish, nice bitterness to counter the sweetness. Very good!

26-DEC-2016, bottle @home, from Kihoskh.
Hazy amber with a lasting, tan head,
Aroma is Bourbon. Bourbon first. Then some wood and alcohol.
Taste the same with more BW notes like nuts. Smooth, quite alcoholic, some bitterness but not a lot, lively carbonation. Great brew again from Pohjala:-)
Bottle. Pours deep brown with low head. Aroma is vanilla, bourbon, toffee. Flavour is barley, malty, vanilla, wood, creamy. Nice.

Bottle from Beershop No.2 Gambrinus. Pours deep mahogany with small beige head. Vanilla, caramel, raisins, toffee in the aroma. Taste is quite sweet and follows the aroma with some bourbon and oak. ABV is well hidden, full body, low carbonation, nicely balanced. Awesome sipper
Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with small off-white head. Aroma is dried fruits and caramel. Taste has sweet malts, caramel, dried fruits and bourbon.
Oranje koper bier met een kleine witte schuim kraag. Ruikt bourbon, vanille, alcohol, overrijp fruit. Smaakt zoet, vanille, alcohol, overrijp fruit.
Roodbruine kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt vol, vanille, crème, bourbon. Smaakt vol, vanille, crème, bourbon, alcohol.
Ruikt sterk en barrel aged. Dubbel achtig uiterlijk. Minder sterk en lekker dan je verwacht.
Clear dark ruby brown, light brown short lasting foam head. Bourbon aroma and taste, light coffee notes, bourbon dominates. Nice sipping beer. (Velp 201612)

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2016 Bottle, pours dark ruby with an off white head. Big boozy bourbon, toffee, raisins, dried fruit, oak. Sweet, boozy, moderate bitter, slick. Pretty nice, but not nice enough to warrant hard wax...

Hazy dark amber color with a bit of tan foam. Aroma has really nice bourbon, smooth and not boozy at all, with caramel and toasted coconut. Taste has really nice bourbon flavors, sweet malt but gets more bitter towards the finish with earthy hops. Really nice coconut on the aftertaste. Medium body, low carbonation. ABV is hidden extremely well, no heat, no burn. Really good barleywine with excellent bourbon characteristics.
Pours dark amber, no head. Bourbon caramel malty aroma. Taste is malty caramel bourbon woody alcohol.

Bottle. Pours an amber color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty woody bourbon caramel aroma. Fruity malty woody caramel bourbon flavor. Has a fruity malty sweetish woody bourbon caramel finish.

Kolor: miedziany, delikatnie zamglony.
Piana: niska, drobnopęcherzykowa, w miarę trwała.
Zapach: wyraźne aromaty słodowe, słodkie, ciemne, kandyzowane owoce, trochę kojarzący się miodem pitnym, delikatne aromaty drewna, burbon również niewiele. 
Smak: wyraźna pełnia, lekka gęstość, trochę słodyczy, sporo nut słodowych, ciemnych owoców, daktyli, fig, delikatne nuty drewna, burbona, średnia goryczka, spory alkohol, piekący, przyjemnie rozgrzewa.
Wysycenie: średnie, w kierunku niskiego.
Bottle at home. Pours deep amber, nose is coconut, toffee, vanilla, caramel, leather, taste is sweet, creamy, toffee, caramel, light bitterness, coconut, little boozy.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, nice wex sealed bottle, pours small white head, dark orange color, aroma: caramel, toffee, bourbon whisky, full bodied, subtle bitterness, fruit, smooth monthfeel, well balanced and well hided alcohol.

33cl bottle shared at home. Clear dark amber brown with a small off-white head. Full body with low carbonation. Quite sweet with subtle bitter tones. Caramel, malts, booze, dried fruits and spices. Quite overwhelming, but still a nice brew.
Bottle. Deep dark brown color. Malt, dried fruit bourbon and vanilla in the aroma and flavor. Sweet, alcoholic, caramel. Warming. Oak in the finish. Powerful.

Sample at All In Beer Fest 2016. Amber with off white head. English barley wine with fruit, dried fruit, waming alcohol and with nice addition of bourbon and oak. Semi dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Draught at All In Beer Fest 2016, 2016-11-04 Göteborg 
AR:bourbon vanilla, raisins, pruns
AP: ruby thicj, wee beige travces of a head
F: bourbon vanillla, raisins, fine portwine, pruns - nice brew!
Sample at All In Beer Fest. Fruity smell with dried fruit and cereal. Similar taste, dried fruit. Sweet with a thick body. Boozy, but I would have never guessed 16%.
Allin brewfest. Doft av portvin o något vinöst. Smaken nja alldeles för vinösa toner o alkohol. Visst ett försök att göra något intressant som slog helt fel.
On tap @ All in Beer Fest 2016. Cloudy amber with a tiny off white head. Fruity and vanilla tones. Fruit, malt, wood and vanilla. Full body with a long fruity / malty finish.

Bottle. Sensoric. Bought at Warszawski Festival Piwa. Deep brown/reddish with small, very light brown, semi-thick head. Poor head retention and lacing. Deeply caramel notes, some spices aroma, dried fruits, honestly dont feel bourbon notes at all, may be stag wrong with my nose. Taste is heavily malty (sweet), but perfectly balanced with heavy hoppy an bitter character. Full body, thick texture, soft carbonation, finish is heavy and sweet. In general this one comparing to regular version do not have so sophisticated bourbon-like notes. Despite this... Guys from Pohjala perfectly combined heavily malty and sweet character with heavily hoppy and bitter notes. Everything has perfect timing, thats a big thing.

Fat på Eriksberg. Doftar bärigt lite vinöst . Smakar hemskt likt ett starkvin och eftersmaken än värre.. oerhört syrligt??!. brutalt likt ett ful vin bryggda hemma i källaren. Har INGET med Barely wine eller öl att göra.
Taste at all in beer fest. Amber, beige head. Caramel, syrup, bourbon. Sweet but lovely sweetness. Sting from the alcohol. Great be

Bottled. Hazy and deep amber body with a small off-white head. Aroma of toasted caramel, vanilla, wood and bourbon. Sweet flavor that ends up slightly more dry with some alcohol. Medium bodied, oily to syrupy texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Barley Wine indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Bottle shared by Emil and Gustav <3 Pours clear dark reddish brown with a small bubbly white head. Aromas of syrup, caramel, vanilla, butterscotch, milk chocolate, malt, rye bread. Taste is malty, caramel, fudge, vanilla, chocolate, light bitter, oaky, boozy heat.

A small taste from a friend (bottle) @ Olut Expo 2016. Pours clear golden with a medium head. Aroma is sweet malts with plenty of bourbon. Flavor is sweet malts, bourbon, fruity notes and hops. Very good.

bottle from our local bottle shop, poured a slight cloudy deep amber to brown colour with a light tanned head on top. nose of sweet caramel malts, vanilla, light butter, butterscotch, ripe fruits, oak, spiced bourbon, cacao. taste is sticky syrup, hot alcoholic aftertaste. pretty nice brew, but way to alcoholic. bit to much

On tap @ Whats Brewing, Stavanger. Pours hazy maroon, with a small head. Aroma is over ripe fruits, wooden barrels and some earthy notes. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is wooden barrels, earthy fruity notes and earthy notes.

Bardzo dobre, mocne piwo. CZasem przy 16% zanika różnica czy pijemy jeszcze piwo czy to już drink z piwem. W smaku słodkie, rozgrzewające, na finiszu goryczka. Wysycenie minimalne. W zapachu Bourbon przesłania praktycznie wszystko i jest w tym piwie na pierwszym miejscu. Momentami alkoholu w tym piwie jest za wiele, gdyby go lepiej ukryć byłoby dużo lepiej

Shared bottle at home. Pours dark ruby with off-white head. Aroma of vanilla, coconut, alcohol, red wine, sherry, chocolate, caramel, whisky, herbs. Taste sweet and quite bitter with some umami. Very bitter aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with strong alcoholic warmth.

Tap at Speakeasy. Malts and bourbon on the nose, luckily not as bourbony as feared. So soft and smooth initially, but 2 seconds later the booze becomes overpowering. So yea, struggling from the start. Malts, and sweeter caramel and dates flavour most dominant. Thin carbonation. Overall not very enjoyable TBH. Will rerate soon.

Bottle speak easy Tallinn this place is due to be demolished in two weeks!!! Red colour. Nice bourbon aroma taste is sweet good malts nice bourbon good abv strength but so easy to drink. Great mouthfeel. Amazing stuff!!

Bottle. Pours dark caramel brown with very little head that lingers at the edges. Heavily carbonated - shockingly so for the style (I thought it might be infected). Nice vanilla flavor with a bit of heat. Too thin. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Glass at de 24 uurs van Maastricht, Brown red with a small head. Aroma is malt, caramel, bourbon, Taste is the same, bitter with some sweetness.

draft @ TCBW16. Dark orangebrown colour. Beautiful rich aroma of sweet barley, soft spices, dark fruit/raisins/vanilla sweetness and soft tones of bourbon and oak. This all comes back in the taste, with alcohol clearly present, but not annoying or burning. Verry smooth and rich. Im not a barleywine-fan, but this one was one of my festival-favourites.

Draft sample @ TCBW 16.Ambré, léger voile, col beige épais.
Arôme au nez assez volumineux, plein de malts, caramel, chaleur barrique et Bourbon en rétro-nasal, le tout avec une pointe de biscuité et fine note de noisettes.
Palais est également centré sur une certaine épaisseur niveau malts et grains, houblonné ajoutant une fine note épicée. Le tout est collant aux lèvres caramélisé presque toffeee avec un niveau chaleur des 16% qui se fait sentir. Le tout est solide même si jaurais aimé qcq chose de moins fort, le tout se terminant sur un malt grilé-biscuité plaisant.

Syrupy maltiness, distinct bourbon notes, vanilla, caramel, candy, some wood, raisins, bit herbal. Intense sweetness with moderate bitterness.
Well balanced, awesome sipper
Draft @ Metenis-2016. Taste and aroma: bourbon, vanilla, toffee, candy, oak, warming, sweet, very malty, perfect.

Pours dark brown with ruby reflexes. Head is medium, disappearing pretty fast. Aroma: pleasant fresh coconut, with a touch of bourbon, vanilla, dark malt. Taste: incredibly complex, with dark malt, followed by vanilla, brown sugar, some wood. All very balanced. Palate is very interesting: first bitter from the hopps, than pleasant warming alcohol. This barrel aged barley wine is just world class.

Aroma: whiskey, spicy, honey, bread, toast. Appearance: dark red, brown, almost no head, clear. Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. Palate: full body, oily feel, average carbonation, slightly astringent long finish.

33cl bottle at Grünerløkka brygghus, Oslo (Põhjala tap takeover). Pours very dark caramel brown with a fairly modest beige head. Malty aroma with quite some caramel in it and fairly dominating bourbon notes, some dried fruits and hints of herbs. Rather sweet, but the bourbon flavour makes it more drinkable. Thought the regular one was to sweet, guess this is just as sweet, just not as dominating. Vinous or more close to liqueur I guess, but certainly a nice sipper. Not quite my thing or style, but still quite delicious.

Bottle 0.33l at Brewdog Helsinki, Helsinki. BBE 01.11.2020. Colour is clear dark orange with very small white head. Aromas and flavours: Caramel, sweetness, some alcohol, bourbon, raisins and malts. Very warming.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2016 dark clear maogany red liquid without head. aroma of coconuts, toffee, booze. taste of toffee, coconuts, booze, chocolate, heavy sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Clear, copper brown. Minimal white head. Aroma has malt, raisin, sour berry. 

Taste has malt, raisin, wood and honey. Big body and a long aftertaste on the bitter side. Reminds me of sherry. Some sweet notes. No carbonation.
Deep re with small head. Bourbon, vanilla, wood, sugar, dry fruits. Good balance and warming. A great beer for a cold night.

33cl bottle @Brewdog helsinki. Pours deep mahogany color with a thin white head. Bready, dark fruity, alcohol, plums in aroma. Flavor has sweetness, toffee, fudge, vanilla, caramel. Nice balance, Bourbon done good here.

Rated pe 08.01.2016.[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ hki. Amber orangy cedary brown, low head. Strong sweet bourbon on nose, caramelly toffee malty, some wild herbs. Med full bodied, sweet, syrupy, but bitters enough for balance. Very bourbony drink, youd really have to like that vanilla woody sweet cornyness to enjoy this. Whick I do, so great imo.-- bb

33 cl bottle @ Rotterdam. Batch #150: BBE 01.11.2020. Aroma has alcohol, caramel, acetylen and woody notes. Flavour has chlorine, woody notes, toffee, caramel and vanilla. Also warming alcohol. This has a bit too weak body compared to the flavour bouquet. Also too woody and dry.

330ml bottle @ Rotterdam, Helsinki. Pours dark brown with no head. Aroma of sweet buttery bourbon, toffee, oak, vanilla, caramel and candy. Taste is heavy with bourbon notes, wood, vanilla, oak, toffee and syrup. Finish is stingy, woody and oaky with loads of bourbon and some caramely maltiness and warming alcohol. Feels quite light bodied despite the high ABV. Quite a bourbon overdose.

Nice head, which almost disappears after few minutes. Colour: deep red or transparent bronze. Aroma: bourbon, bread, creamy caramel candies. First taste: caramel and some smoke. Bourbon, oakiness, cream liqeur, vanilla, raisins afterwards.

Heavy-bodied, but very well balanced, rather less carbonated, intresting and extremely complex beer, which should be shared and discussed among best friends.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2016 Bottle at Beer Hunters, Pori. Dark ruby color. Tiny off-white head. Bourbon, vanilla aroma. Medium-bodied. Lots of vanilla, alcoholic, bourbon "heat". Burning alcohol in the aftertaste. Boozy but interesting. Maybe not so much cellaring potential as finish is quite thin. (7/3/7/4/14 3.5)
Tap at TCBW2016. Dark amber color, small steady beige head. Aroma has alcohol, toffee and perfumic hops. Medium-bodied to full-bodied. Toffeeish, vanilla, some hops. Dessert beer and nicely sippable despite of abv. (7/4/8/4/16 3.9)

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2016 Pours dark amber with minimum yellowish head. Aroma is sweetish, toffee, caramel, chocolate, bourbon, dark berries. Taste is sweet with some bitterness, a bit warming alcohol, toffee, chocolate, caramel, hay, wood, whiskey. Full body. Sweet finish. Grate balance. Good job.

Tap. Hazy ruby red color. Tiny to almost no head. Sweet, toffee, caramel, raisins, woody, berries, just a hint of alcohol and lots of Bourdox red wine in aroma. Sweet, massive toffee, woody, oak, plum cake in taste. Just massive toffee with some oaky red wine in aftertaste. Alcohol is there, but not in front line at first, but as it warms up alcohol comes out strongly. Soft carbonation. Full body. Complex sipper.

Tap @ Speakeasy by Põhjala.

Very deep dark ruby color, light carbonation. Nice rich aroma of vanilla, some dried exotic fruits even - reminds me of bourbon Makers Mark. Taste is very intense, complex, with lots of woody, vanilla, coconut notes, though alcohol isnt well hidden. Aftertaste is slight bitter, quite hard to drink. Overall - good BA beer, shall be better after ageing in bottles.

30cl from tap in to a swingtop, and enjoyed some hours later. Greets to Marduk! Got served right before me.
Clear, pure bourbon nose - due to carbonation - even much more than in a warm bourbon. Aroma strongly resembles Westbrook Mexican Cake Imperial Stout. Hazy dark orange, and not as clear as original Odravein, though looks are least important in the heavy artillery. Malty, again malty, raisins, prunes, cinnamon, bourbon (basically this beer is already 40% of original bourbon abv), some ash and chilly. Dark palm sugar is in the aftertaste, but not a burnt one.
It is oily, yet fizzy, yet again slimy and sticky, sugary mess. Does not go down as smooth as original, but it is not meant to. You feel like you drink JimBeam with some smooth bitter instead of cola. Hard to imagine any other texture for barrel aged strong beer. Usually it is thinner and more watery. This is not the case.
I got what I expected. This is a perversion of a beer, and should be enjoyed in moderation. Imho, it definitely will age very well (in case I will secure myself a bottle or 2).
It is one of those beers that is best when sheared in a sherry glass.
P.S. I have poured everything into a large 0.6L snifter, and I have poured nearly half of it back to the bottle when I finished writing. It took me 25 minutes to understand those 150ml of this creation.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2016 Tap. Pours dark ruby-amber. Aroma is sweet, vanilla and a lot of alcohol Flavor is sweet, vanilla, malt, caramel, bourbon, and a lots of alcohol. Finish is dry bitter. Overall: OK, somewhat more balanced than the original version, but even more boozy. Who tought that making a booze bomb more boozy is a good idea?!  Why did you pour boubon in my beer?! 6:3:6:3:14=3.2 
Bottle at põrgu. Its sweeter, less booze (no nasty vodka alcohol the tap version had), more vanilla sweetness and barrel, easier to drink than tap version, but still not even close to the world class stuff. Rating: 7:3:7:3:14=3.4
23.09.2016 update: tap version of 2015 and bottle of 2016 in vertical. 2015 tap didnt have nasty vodka flavor anymore, but was still rather thin and boozy and very simple. 2016 bottle was more sweet, more caramel driven, but still nothing special. Rating for 2016 bottle would be around 3.5, 2015 tap 3.3-3.4

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2015 Tap (Speakeasy, Tallinn)
Nice deep red, clear, no head. Served extremely cold, so initially no aroma at all. I got a bit of brie for a while, not sure where that came from. As it warms, the bourbon comes over more, and you can get a bit of vanilla, and even some coconut. Full smooth palate, but the carbonations a bit high and prickles a bit. Retronasals a bit almondy, some alcohol rushes up too if you leave it on your tongue at all. On swallowing, theres a clear bourbon taste, and I dont just mean the barrel ageing, the spirit. Tastes of beer with a whiskey depthcharge, and as such seems kinda fake. Finishes with a burn, and a touch of numbness. Late finish does have some very pleasant hops though. Decent in small sips, but Im regretting buying 2 glasses. O at an unusual and unexpected 12. Having said that, as I sip more, its beginning to latch onto my sugar pleasure centres, and the alcohol is diminishing my ability to resist it. Ill pop the O back up to 13 for that.
Rerate: 330ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut
Sweet and boozy aroma, some caramel cakiness. taste super fucking sweet. Boozy aroma cant go unmentioned, quite a whaft. Heady. Christ, Im getting drunk just sniffing this. Drinkability limited to sips. Nice woodiness in the finish, some dark rubber.

Tap. Slightly hazy brownish red beer, almost no head. Nose is heavy on the bourbon and oaky vanilla, sweetness, caramel notes. Flavor is bourbon, caramel, malt notes, vanilla. Smooth, but boozy finish with more vanilla and oak notes. Aftertaste is long and boozy to the point of being harsh. Vanilla and barley malt in the retronasals. Smooth mouthfeel, syrupy. This needs a chaser. Booze detracts from the overall impression, flavor minus alcohol is pretty nice.
